title: London/South Kensington-Chelsea
name: Royal College of Music
price: Museum: Free. Performances: Varies but many are free (although tickets may be required)
content: Victorian school of music created on a suggestion by Prince Albert.  It is still an active school but visitors may be more interested in its museum and performances.  The free museum houses instruments dating back to the 15th century with several unusual pieces.  Performances—by students, professors or visitors—are often free as well.
